definition: to shine (of talents, skills, accomplishment)/to demonstrate extraordinary talent or skill
to project singular splendor or radiance/to perform brilliantly

sentences.english: And make Tianjin caly figurines is to shine is famous of Zhang's Painted caly figurines.
sentences.chinese: 而使得天津泥塑大放异彩的，是“泥人张”的彩塑。

sentences.english: Under the sunshine, the water of Kanas Lake is resplendent with colors.
sentences.chinese: 你看，在阳光的照射下，喀纳斯湖的湖水流光异彩。

sentences.english: It was a colorful page of history in Tang dynasty classics.
sentences.chinese: 唐代经学是经学史上的一抹异彩。

sentences.english: All communication projects will shine brilliantly.
sentences.chinese: 所有沟通项目都将大放异彩。

sentences.english: Moreover, 2NE1′s explosive charisma will shine regardless of the size of the venue.
sentences.chinese: 此外，2NE1的爆炸魅力将大放异彩无论场地大小。

sentences.english: Today, the sinology flower is blooming in Yuancheng Foreign Language School.
sentences.chinese: 今天，国学这支奇葩正在校园绽放奇光异彩。

sentences.english: Hakka Folk Songs in Guangdong is an artistic miracle of folk arts in China.
sentences.chinese: 广东客家山歌是中国民间艺苑中一支独具异彩的奇葩。

sentences.english: He's a rhythm shooter and he'll have some big nights.
sentences.chinese: 他是个节奏感很强的投手，很多个夜晚都能大放异彩。

sentences.english: Once you light Darwinian evolution, it takes off.
sentences.chinese: 一旦推崇达尔文主义进化论，它会大放异彩。

sentences.english: The Yuan era brimmed with diverse cultures and religions.
sentences.chinese: 元朝是各种宗教和文化异彩纷呈的时代。

sentences.english: In the sound of gongs and drums for celebrating rich harvest, you radiate extraordinary splendour of youth.
sentences.chinese: 在欢庆丰收的锣鼓声中，你绽放青春的异彩。

sentences.english: Only by so doing will various civilizations in the world blossom with radiant splendor.
sentences.chinese: 这样，世界文明的百花园才能异彩纷呈。

sentences.english: That's right, tonight our show is so colorful.
sentences.chinese: 没错今晚我们可是为大家准备了很多异彩纷呈的节目。

sentences.english: And sometimes, that light becomes splendiferous.
sentences.chinese: 有时候，这样的轻松会发出异彩。

sentences.english: Modern architecture of wealthyJapan, an economic giant, is more colorful.
sentences.chinese: 经济大国的日本的现代建筑探索更是异彩纷呈。

sentences.english: Explore your partner Leo, shine your light on them this week.
sentences.chinese: 本周好好探索下你的伴侣，在他们身上大放异彩吧。

definition: to shine (of talents, skills, accomplishment)/to demonstrate extraordinary talent or skill
to dazzle/to brighten up (a room etc)
lit. flowing light and overflowing color/brilliant lights and vibrant colors (idiom)
to amaze the world with a single brilliant feat (idiom); an overnight celebrity
